content:
Great! Here are some practice questions related to Linux and text editors:

1. What does the "ls" command do in Linux?
2. What is the difference between "mkdir" and "touch" commands in Linux?
3. What does the "grep" command do in Linux?
4. What is the purpose of the "nano" text editor in Linux?
5. What does the "chmod" command do in Linux?
6. What is the difference between "vi" and "vim" text editors in Linux?
7. What does the "cat" command do in Linux?
8. What is the purpose of the "emacs" text editor in Linux?
9. What does the "cp" command do in Linux?
10. What is the purpose of the "sed" command in Linux?

These questions should help students get familiar with some basic commands and text editors in Linux.
